intro: Corydalis ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, creeping growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
